newsitem.title: USA: St. Paul has unrealized investment gain.
newsitem.headline: St. Paul has unrealized investment gain.

text.p: St. Paul Cos said its $3.7 million investment in Advanced Fibre Communications Inc has resulted in an unrealized gain of approximately $160 million at today's market price.
The stock of Advanced Fibre, a high-tech communications company, rose to $56 per share from $25 in its first week of trading and is now trading at 50-1/2, down 5-3/4.

St. Paul Venture Capital, St. Paul Cos' private investment subsidiary, owns about 10 percent of Advanced Fibre, or 3.25 million common stock equivalents at an average cost of $1.14 per share, including the cost to exercise warrants.
St. Paul said it has been an investor in Advanced Fibre since late 1992.

St. Paul said it is party to a lock-up agreement with underwriters for the initial public offering. That agreement precludes St. Paul from selling or disposing of the stock for 180 days after the initial public offering date without consent of Morgan Stanley & Co Inc.
St. Paul is a group of companies providing property-liability insurance underwriting and insurance brokerage products and services.
